job_title: Business Intelligence Analyst in Columbus, IN
pros: Organization strives to maintain a healthy work-life balance Generous benefit options Employer matching retirement plans Generous paid time off accruals Remote work available for many positions
cons: Advancement can be a challenge because of employee tenure. Not necessarily a bad thing for the organization, rather if someone is at the associate level and would like to advance to intermediate, they would need to wait for a role at that level to open. Given employees with long tenure hold those spots, it may be a while before advancement opportunities are available.

review_title: Poor culture, top heavy, not focused on the care they provide or the nursing profession.

pros:
Not part of larger conglomerate Hospital systems
Great benefits
cons:
As with most Hospital nursing staff positions across the realm... Do More with Less and Do it Faster. 
The complexity of patient needs, comorbities, technology all continue to increase yet the ability of Hospital management to recognize these increases require more time and more help and continue to demand it be done with less help and less time but (of course) maintain pt satisfaction and safety.

job_title: Professional Nurse II in Columbus, IN
pros: Great teamwork, nurse manager and asst. nurse manager are very supportive. Most of the doctors are amazing to work with and we have an amazing case manager covering our floor. Additional training/education is not only supported,  it's encouraged. Definitely room to grow and paths pursue if you want to expand your practice/knowledge.
cons: Staffing is always short, lots of agency nurses. Seems to be lots of changes/shakeups that keep happening and some units are hemorrhaging staff faster than we could ever hope to replace them. Change is hard but it seems upper management and management on other units are making it even harder than it needs to be.  Even when warned this would be the outcome, we were met with "nurses can be replaced".  Staffing has become a nightmare on some units/shifts and patient care/outcome is suffering because of it.  There are a couple units I hate floating to because the seasoned, amazing nurses have abandoned ship and all that is left are the new grads, agency, and less than mediocre staff that don't have any great options of finding other positions.

pros: None that I can think of.
cons: Promotes from within which isn’t a bad thing unless you are a patient in certain areas. Food service manager promoted to surgery dept management. ICU severely understaffed. People working in surgery on call for weeks at a time because they can’t keep people in that dept. One lady does all the lung pft’s and has been that way for years. Which means they are scheduled out months for those. Management picks favorites and at the slightest mistake you are gone. Then you are blacklisted from pretty much every medical place in Columbus because the hospital owns almost all of them. Most management does not provide positive feedback. Only negative feedback. Worries more about having staff involved  with community projects than providing adequate staffing for current patients.

review_title: Outstanding patient care and Excellent work environment
pros:
Perfect size - big enough to offer cutting edge treatments in a wide variety of specialties, and small enough to know your coworkers, physicians, and executives personally. 
This company never stops trying to improve itself and the experience that it provides patients, visitors, the community, and the employees. It isn't perfect - no company is - but leadership listens and has a conversation to find solutions that make sense.  
Yes, you will be asked to work hard and in pursuit of putting the patient first. You will be held accountable for your work and asked to hold your team members accountable for theirs.  But you will be paid competitively, recognized for your efforts, make some great friends, and feel like you are making a personal contribution to the good of the patients in this area.
cons: It may not be the right place for everyone due to the frequency of change and the enforced environment of self-accountability.

review_title: I have always been treated respectfully & fairly and management is very supportive of my personal & professional growth.
pros: CRH often promotes from within so there are many opportunities for growth. The offer some tuition reimbursement and the CRH foundation will help with scholarships. The benefits package is better than most and many local business offer discounts for hospital employees.
cons: Some departments have managers that micromanage or play favoritism. Not everyone has had the same positive experience I have had. My advice to anyone who ends up working for one of those sour managers, just wait 90 days and bid for a job in a different department. Most prefer to hire from within so it is easy to change your environment if you are unhappy or bored.

pros: Low level management are good (department managers), Family-like working condition, tuition reimbursement for school, opportunities to grow and to explore other fields. Most of the physician are nice to work with.
cons: Short staffed, high turnover in the recent 3 years, lack of appreciation of their employees, A pay cut did happen due to reason to follow a standardized pay in the area (???), resulting  people leaving and hiring of more travel nurses. Seem cant retain new hires,

pros: They are always willing to work with people, whether it's a schedule conflict, issues with the job itself, etc. Fast-paced job that provides experience in all parts of the hospital, as well as interactions with other hospital staff and patients.
cons: Favoritism plays a big part. Lots of "bullying" from older coworkers who get away with it because they've been there so long. Little oversight from department manager. They like to sweep problems under the rug instead of dealing with them head on.

pros: Middle management in my Dept and most others is awesome. Coworkers are great to work with and always help each other. Pay for performance is supposed to be coming back next month.
cons: It feels like upper management and administration staff are getting culled out or jumping ship since covid. The CEO and admin staff dont appear to care for the everyday worker and often have what feel like canned responses to concerns and comes off fake during briefings. Recently there are entire depts that close/"reorganize" or sold off to third party companies to be outsourced.

review_title: Improvement process needs implemented but it goes in 1 ear and out the other.
pros: Coworkers, flexible hours in case schooling arises, flexibility with in phlebotomy to move around if current situation isn't working out, Some OT available
cons: Turn over like crazy, too much info thrown at you at once with no handbook or knowledgeable place to find it, stressful, short staffed

pros: Management was incredibly helpful and informative. Worked closely with management and executive level individuals so I was able to soak up a ton of info.
cons: There was really nothing negative about my experience. If I was not working on a project they had me shadowing either a manager, director or executive.

review_title: You are the lowest paid job at the hospital
pros: If you We're in with the clique then at least you had your team to count on
cons: Pay was awful Management was awful always playing favorites, never helping when you asked for it. Always stressed you out by putting more work on you and always kept it short staffed and made it feel like you were the problem when really it's quite obvious Management was poor.

pros: Always get my hours in for the week. Love the people I work with. Tight knit group of nurses, Techs, and Aids
cons: Lots of On Call hours. People don't like change. Not a lot of accountability for staff members that don't pull their weight in patient care and team work

pros: Friendly staff, clean, good benefits, good 403 b plan. Management not,friendly or approachable. CPR classes good. Acls great. Equipment new.
cons: Short staffed, software horrible, pharmacy short staffed, doctors won't return calls and hateful. Constantly,calling you on your days off to work.
